intro: Fagara klaineana, commonly known as the Klainean soursop, is a tropical plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces a fruit that is similar in appearance to a soursop but has a distinct flavor and texture. It is often grown for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth.
